{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has a recurrent infection with gram negative diplococci within white blood cells. This suggests that the infection is caused by Neisseria gonorrhoeae, which is a common cause of urethritis. The patient's lack of lasting immunity to N. gonorrhoeae can be attributed to the bacterium's ability to undergo antigenic variation, which allows it to evade the host's immune system.", "answer_choice": "B"}
